question: The following descriptions about complement system which one is CORRECT?

options.A: The highest concentration of the complement component in the serum is C5, that is why the patients with deficiency of C5 have recurrent infections.
options.B: There are 3 pathways, classical, lectin and alternative pathway. These pathways differ in how C3 is produced but follow a common sequence after C5 cleavage.
options.C: In classical pathway, both antigen-bound and antigen-free antibody can bind and activate C1 component.
options.D: Activated C3a and C5a can covalently bind to the bacterial cell wall and initiate phagocytosis

question: Antimicrobial peptides (AMP) are part of innate immunity. Which of the statement is CORRECT?

options.A: AMPs have a selectivity against bacterial but not host cells.
options.B: AMPs are part of mechanical barrier to prevent the entry of pathogens.
options.C: AMPs are amphipathic peptides that have a hydrophilic end and a hydrophobic end.
options.D: AMPs are only secreted by immune cells but not nonimmune cells.

question: About phagocytosis, which is CORRECT?

options.A: The phagocytosis mechanism by neutrophil and macrophage is very different.
options.B: When antigen is phagocytosed by neutrophil and macrophage, the pH in the phagolysosomes of the cell will increase to digest the antigen.
options.C: Only macrophage but not neutrophil will secrets AMP when performing phagocytosis.
options.D: Only neutrophil but not macrophage will perform a special kind of apoptosis called NETosis, which releases its DNA to trap antigens.

question: Pattern recognition receptors (PRR) are expressed on most innate immune cells that can recognize pathogen-associated molecular patterns (PAMPs). Which of following statement is NOT CORRECT?

options.A: TLR4 requires MD2 to facilitate the binding of LPS, a key component of gram-negative bacterial cell wall.
options.B: PRRs are expressed on different compartments of immune cells, including plasma membrane, cytosol, endosome and nucleus.
options.C: NLR (Nod-like receptor), CLR (C-type lectin receptor), RLR (Rig-I like receptor), TLR (Toll-like receptor) and CDS (Cytosolic DNA sensor) all belong to PRR.
options.D: The binding of PAMP to PRR usually results in production of cytokines, including IL-6, TNFα and type I interferon.

question: In terms of antibody structure, which statement is CORRECT?

options.A: CDR1, 2, 3 both heavy chain and light chain determines the binding region structure with antigen.
options.C: The production of membrane bound or secreted form of IgM in a B cells is determined by DNA rearrangement.

question: Monoclonal antibody (mAb) is important for treating diseases. Which statement concerning mAbs are CORRECT?

options.A: Traditional way to make mAbs is to fuse a naive B cell with a tumor B cell line.
options.B: There is no way to make an mAb against an antibody because they are the same.
options.C: Anti-CTLA-4 and Anti-PD-1 antibodies are two mAbs successfully used to treat cancer patients.
options.D: Trastuzumab is a fully human antibody.

question: Presentation of pre-B receptor is an important checkpoint in B cell development. Which statement concerning signal from pre-B receptor is CORRECT?

options.A: Will inhibit light chain gene rearrangement
options.B: Will promote heavy chain gene rearrangement
options.C: Will promote surrogate light gene rearrangement

question: Regarding ITAM and ITIM, which is NOT CORRECT?

options.A: Upon activation by tyrosine phosphorylation, ITAM recruits kinases to positively regulate immune response.
options.B: CTLA4 can negatively regulate T cell response by competing the binding of B7 with CD28 and simultaneously transduce negative signal.
options.C: T cell receptor (TCR) itself has 6 ITAMs in its intracellular domain to trigger signal events after engaging with MHC-peptide.
options.D: Immune checkpoint blockade for cancer treatment is using anti-CTLA-4 or anti-PD1 to inhibit the negative signals in T cells.

question: Post-transcriptional modification like tyrosine phosphorylation is important for many reactions. Which statement is NOT CORRECT?

options.A: Tyrosine on the receptor is phosphorylated for initiation.
options.B: Scaffold protein is phosphorylated to recruit downstream molecules.
options.C: When the phosphate is removed by protein tyrosine phosphatase, the signal will be terminated.
options.D: Non-tyrosine kinase receptors use intracellular kinase domain to phosphorylate its downstream molecules.

question: Which one of the following signaling determines the commitment of T-cell lineage?

options.C: RAS

question: Mutant with MHC class I transgene that cannot interact with CD8:

options.C: Only CD8+ T

question: Double-negative T cell with CD44+, CD25- markers:

options.C: DN3 T cell

question: Which protein does not participate in RAG-dependent V(D)J Rearrangement?

options.C: TdT

question: When the two gene segments are in the same transcriptional orientation in the germ line DNA, their DNA rearrangement involves X and Y of the DNA between them?

options.C: looping-out and deletion

question: The exogenous pathway of loading peptide/antigen onto MHC class 1 is called cross-presentation and is actively practiced by X.

options.C: Hepatocyte cell

question: Which feature of class I molecules is not correct?

options.B: CD8 mainly binds to alpha 3 domain
options.C: Location of polymorphic are alpha 1 & 2 domain
options.E: Polypeptide chains are Alpha and beta

question: 下列關於 Class I MHC pathway 中的抗原處理與呈現，何者不正確？(原題目為英文)

options.A: 所有有核的細胞都是 APC
options.B: CD8+ T cell is type of responsive T cell
options.C: ER 是 peptide load 到 MHC 上的地方
options.D: TAP-1/2參與了 peptide 的裝載與呈現

question: Which of the following proteins is not a component of the peptide loading complex (PLC)?

options.C: LMP7

question: About superantigen, which is false?

options.B: Does not bind to the conventional peptide binding groove.
options.C: Bacterial superantigens bind mainly to the Vb CDR2 loop.
options.D: Viral superantigens bind mainly to the hypervariable 2 (HV2) loop.
options.E: Toxic shock syndrome toxin-1 (TSST-1) is a bacterial superantigen.

question: cytokine induce IgA?

options.C: TNF-α

question: Which kind of cell expresses FcɛRI?

options.C: Macrophage

question: CD4+T可促進APC表現X及B7,以活化 CD8+T,請問X為下列何者?(原題目為英文)

options.C: CTLA-4

question: Which of the following cell-surface molecules is not expressed in activated T-cell?

options.C: VLA-4

question: STAT6 is mainly expressed in which subset of CD4+ T cell?
What kind of cytokine can be secreted by pDC?

options.C: IFN-α

question: Which one of the following microbes is the target of TH2 cells?

options.C: Klebsiella spp

question: Herd immunity is best described as

options.B: Protecting individuals who have not been vaccinated
options.C: Vaccinating the contacts of an infected person
options.D: Using multiple vaccines at one time

question: Which of the following is wrong?

options.A: Using immunosuppressive drugs may cause increase the risk of infection
options.B: CAR-T include extracellular domain, transmembrane domain, and an intercellular signaling domain
options.C: Antibody can be engineered to increase immunogenicity by humanization
options.D: Tumor cells may be eliminated by the immune system, but as they evolve, variants occur and eventually escape immune surveillance and form tumor
options.E: HPV vaccine can prevent cervical cancer

question: About transplantation, which one is incorrect?

options.A: Thanks to immunosuppressive drug, MHC matching is no longer the major problem of transplantation.
options.C: Major histocompatibility antigen matching is important.
options.D: Minor histocompatibility antigen matching is also important, too.

question: All of the following are tenets of the hygiene hypothesis except

options.A: childhood exposure to microorganisms is increased.
options.B: widespread use of antibiotics interferes with the use and education of the immune system..
options.C: widespread immunization practices compromise the development of a fully functional immune response.
options.D: an increase in allergic disease in developed countries compared to developing countries.
options.E: antibiotic-driven selection of super bacteria perturbs the immune system.

question: Which of the following molecule(s) can transduce inhibitory signal to T cells? (select ALL that apply)

options.C: PD-1
